news.title: Lady Gaga, Bruno Mars and Kendrick Lamar lead the nominations for this years VMAs
news.summary: This year's VMAs introduced two new categories: Best Pop Artist and Best Country.

news.title: Van Morrison adds Waterfront Studio date to lineup of Belfast shows
news.summary: The performance takes place ahead of Van Morrison's 80th birthday weekend

news.title: Chris Haze becomes the first Irish artist to co-publish with Michael Jackson Estate
news.summary: Listen to the new single below.

news.title: Electric Picnic 2025 add Inhaler, David Gray, Jazzy, Nile Rodgers and more to lineup
news.summary: The Saw Doctors, King Kong Company, Mark McCabe and The Coronas have also been added to the lineup.

news.title: 49th & Main: “Some days I feel like a marketing executive, trying to figure out how to do TikToks. We just want to be making music in our bedrooms"
news.summary: With new album Happy Tears confirming them as one of the most exciting Irish acts of recent times, Kilkenny indie-house duo 49th & Main discuss remaining creative throughout illness, their early days in Canada, imposter syndrome, AI, and exploring nostalgia in music.

news.title: Adore announce their debut EP BITER
news.summary: Adore's new EP will feature production from Gilla Band's Daniel Fox

news.title: Offset to release new album Kiari
news.summary: The project's title refers to the birth name of the Grammy-nominated rapper, Kiari Kendrell Cephus.

news.title: Addison Rae announces new Dublin venue and date due to high demand
Nutriband CEO Gareth Sheridan:  “The economy is booming, but that’s a punch to the gut – when we’re a top 5 performer in every major index but our own people can’t afford to live here"
news.summary: Gareth Sheridan is the founder of Nutriband, a Nasdaq-listed company. The company aims to tackle the opioid crisis with innovative patches. Sheridan was inspired by medication his father was taking.
